documents.title: weather : dry tonight , but a few showers and hail possible
text: the last of any showers dying away to leave a dry night across the bbc east region with clear spells and mainly light west to north-westerly winds .
temperatures for many of us staying in double figures , but some spots could fall to around 9c ( 48f ) .
apart from a few light showers , saturday should begin largely fine and dry with some sunshine but eventually heavier showers will move west to east and some of these could produce hail and thunder .
the winds could become quite blustery for a time with isolated gusts of 40mph .
top temperatures around 21c ( 70f ) .
sunday should be fine and dry with sunny spells .
cloud is expected to eventually thicken from the west and temperatures again climbing to around 21c ( 70f ) .
for a more detailed forecast for where you are , visit bbc weather .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: travellers site tenants face eviction

documents.title: football league season begins : posh and cambridge should challenge again
text: with both peterborough united and cambridge united falling just short of the play off places in league one and league two respectively last time out , both sides , based on summer recruitment , ought to be at least flirting with the top of the table again this term .
grant mccann 's posh side have had a rigorous clear-out and are building a side in the manager 's own image .
shaun derry 's u 's have pruned judiciously , and will be looking to start with a bang after failing to win any of their first eight league games at the beginning of last season .
that awful run cost them , at minimum , a play-off berth .
posh freshened-up
mccann has shipped out 11 players on a permanent basis , three more on loan and brought in 10 new faces along with a new assistant in david oldfield .

striker ricky miller , a proven goal-scorer at lower league level , will miss the first six matches through a suspension sustained whilst at dover athletic , but he 's a local boy who 's been prolific during the summer friendlies and could well prove to be one of the bargains of the close season .
posh have a habit of buying or recruiting well from the lower reaches of the pyramid and turning front men into stars that do well higher up .
britt assombalonga , craig mackail-smith , george boyd and conor washington have all made the grade in either the championship or the premier league .
mccann looks , too , to have refreshed his defence in an effort to lock up the back door whilst allowing his side to continue to move forward with flair .
cambridge gain a cutting edge
shaun derry 's task is different - too few goals scored by players other than the prodigious luke berry last season , and too many conceded at the wrong end at the wrong time .
a decent footballing side , there was not enough of an end product to match their often outstanding approach play .
derry will be looking to add a clinical edge to his side , who have already proved they can shut opposition teams out when the need arises , notwithstanding the odd lapse in concentration .
jabo ibehere will add much-needed experience and a cutting edge up front and uche ikpeazu should thrive on the back of ibehre 's know-how .
the u 's have lost talented goalkeeper will norris to wolves , but have replaced him with david forde , who recorded a record number of shut-outs as portsmouth won league two last term .
it does , though , look set to be another roller coaster of a season .
strap in , and turn on !
we 'll be with the posh and the u 's every step of the way - every kick of every match , home and away on bbc radio cambridgeshire , starting this saturday at 14:00 with your host , peter swan .
peterborough are at home to plymouth , while cambridge united travel to exeter .
commentary is only availabe on your fm , am and dab radio , as the bbc does not hold the rights to webstream football league games .
author: Steve Jackson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: pink floyd : no-one believed you could make a career out of rock
text: tomorrow marks the 50th anniversary of pink floyd releasing their influential psychadelic album the piper at the gates of dawn .
founding member nick mason spoke to 6 music 's elizabeth alker earlier today about the changing cultural landscape since it 's release in 1967 .
the sticksman said he never thought the album 's legacy would last half a century .
listen above .
music licensing organisation ppl are also marking the anniversary by compiling a chart of the most-played pink floyd songs on uk radio and tv .
so if you do n't want to know the results , please look away now .
drum roll please nick
most-played pink floyd songs on uk radio and tv .
1 ) another brick in the wall ( part 2 ) ( 1979 )
3 ) wish you were here ( 1975 )
4 ) comfortably numb ( 1979 )
5 ) see emily play ( 1967 )
6 ) the great gig in the sky ( 1973 )
8 ) arnold layne ( 1967 )
9 ) us and them ( 1973 )
10 ) shine on your crazy diamond ( 1975 )
author: BBC 6 Music

documents.title: from the archives : pm visits cambridge observatory in 1980
text: some 37 years ago this month , prime minister margaret thatcher was photographed with her husband dennis at a visit to a telescope at the mullard radio astronomy observatory in cambridge .
also caught on camera was dr john baldwin , the senior radio astronomer .

documents.title: review of city 's traffic lights under way
text: work to overhaul cambridge 's traffic light system to reduce congestion has got under way .
the review of all 104 of the city 's traffic signals is aimed at developing the `` smartest traffic light system '' in the country .
the project is being spearheaded by the greater cambridge partnership .
councillor francis burkitt , chair of the executive board , said 52 of the lights were more than 10 years old .
he said : `` there are lots of things we need to do to sort out the transport problems in cambridge and cambridgeshire , this is just one of them .
`` it will help cyclists , pedestrians and people in vehicles , particularly buses . ''
the traffic light improvements are part of £ 500m worth of transport projects in the region , which are due to be carried out over the next 15 years , said mr burkitt .

documents.title: university challenge pair are 'fearsome duo '
text: a cambridge university student who was one of the breakout stars of university challenge , has said his up-and-coming bbc radio 4 radio show can be likened to `` a clever version of bill and ted 's bogus journey '' .

bobby seagull , who captained emmanuel college on the last series of the quiz show , will team up with rival cambridge contestant - wolfson college 's eric monkman - for monkman & seagull 's polymathic adventure on bbc radio 4 on 21 august .
speaking on bbc radio cambridgeshire , mr seagull said they are `` a fearsome duo '' .
`` eric 's got such an eye for detail .
i 'm more of a big thinking , big ideas person , '' he said .
`` a polymath is a person with a wide range of knowledge and we 're exploring whether there 's a role for polymaths in society .
`` we 've met academics , authors and scientists as well as former university challenge contestant stephen fry . ''
mr seagull said the show is a one-off at the moment , but he expects there 'll be more to come `` if there 's a demand for it '' .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: overrun with rodents ? here 's a happy tail
text: meet rocco and cory .
they 're degus .
very happy degus , as it happens .
these little rodents came from a home in oxford that was overrun with more than 40 fellow degus , gerbils and hamsters .

they were n't particularly happy , all crammed together - so the rspca stepped in and these two brothers ( below ) ended up at the charity 's block fen rehoming centre in wimblington , cambridgeshire .
as cute as they are , no-one wanted little rocco and cory and here they stayed for a more than year before volunteer aga clark thought enough was enough , and adopted the pair .
`` they are two lovely little degus and i saw them and thought it was a shame they spent such a long time in the rspca without a forever home , '' she said .
the pair are now happily living in a big purpose-built cage with lots of toys to play with .
`` i never expected they would be so much fun to be around - they are real characters , '' their new owner said .
characters they may be , but just what is a degu ?
it 's a new one on me so i asked the rspca 's `` degu guru '' dr jane tyson to set me straight :
so now you know !
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: cambridge student shortlisted for trip to mars
text: the mars one project is hoping to take a group of people to the planet on a one-way trip , funded by tv coverage .
the first flight with two men and two women is scheduled for 2031 and would be a one-way trip - they 'd stay there for the rest of their lives .
the dutch company behind it first advertised for volunteers in 2013 and more than 200,000 people originally applied .
that has now been whittled down to 100 finalists , which includes university of cambridge student , ryan macdonald .
ryan is carrying out research at cambridge into ways to detect life outside earth and has written software for a new nasa telescope .
he said : `` to be considered as one of just a hundred people on this planet who may get to go on one of the first expeditions to mars is an incredibly exciting and enticing prospect .
`` thinking about the science we could do there and inspiring young people with this mission - it 's a wonderful time to be alive . ''
ryan is determined to stay in the selection process and training is planned to start towards the end of next year .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: hundreds of well-wishers send cards to crash victim
text: a schoolgirl who lost her father and broke her collar bones in a crash on the a140 has received more than 100 `` get well soon '' cards in the post .
the family of jacee fisk appealed for cards to cheer up the seven-year-old who was seriously injured in the incident near mendlesham industrial estate on 25 july .
her mum has told bbc suffolk today she has also received vouchers and handmade gifts .
she said seeing a smile on her face , thanks to the kindness of complete strangers , is `` amazing '' .
a 50-year-old man from wisbech , dalius matulaitis , has been charged in connection with the crash and is due to appear at ipswich crown court later this month .
author: Kelly McCormack
BBC Radio Suffolk

documents.title: wisbech - you can open your windows , now
text: earlier we told you about a fire in south brink in wisbech - and a police warning to residents to keep doors and windows closed .
well , officers have just told us it 's now safe to open them up again !
the blaze had taken hold in two barns in the area and high winds were blowing smoke and possible fumes over a wide area .
crews are still at the scene but the fire 's now under control , cambridgeshire police say .
you 're fine to open up your doors and windows now , and roads in the area have also been re-opened .
the fire is not being treated as deliberate .

documents.title: fatal b1040 crash car linked to ram-raid
text: an audi which collided with another car on the b1040 near peterborough , killing the other driver , is believed to have been involved in a ram-raid shortly before the crash , police have confirmed .

rugby player mark collin , 51 , died at about 04:20 on tuesday when his green nissan primera and a black audi s3 were involved in a head-on collision between whittlesey and pondersbridge at about 04:20 .
police now believe the audi had earlier been involved in an attempted ram-raid at the co-op in crowland , lincolnshire at about 04:00 , as the peterborough telegraph reported .

the driver of the audi was released under investigation following his arrest on sus of dangerous driving , but sent back to jail when it emerged he had breached the terms of his licence for an unrelated offence .

documents.title: hospital welcomes furry therapist
text: here 's a story to make you smile
three-year-old labradoodle mylo has started his first day volunteering at addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge .

along with owner daisy hill , he visits staff and elderly patients to perk up their day with the high wycombe-based pets as therapy charity , which specially trains animals to visit people in care settings .

documents.title: residents asked to close doors and windows after south brink fire
text: cambridgeshire fire and rescue service are asking people to avoid south brink in wisbech after they were called to a blaze at two barns in the area at 10:50 .
pictures in the wisbech standard show a large plume of black smoke in the area , with residents asked to close their windows and doors due to high winds carrying the fumes .
fire at crooked bank , wisbech .
please avoid area .
fire service are asking for residents to keep doors and windows closed due to high winds

documents.title: fatal b1040 crash suspect sent back to jail
text: a man arrested on sus of dangerous driving following a fatal crash near peterborough on tuesday has been released under investigation by police .
however , he has now been sent back to prison , as it emerged he was out on licence for an unrelated offence at the time of the crash .
rugby player mark collin , 51 , died in the head-on collision on the b1040 near whittlesey at about 04:20 .
officers arrested the driver of an audi , which had been stolen in northamptonshire .
he has been released under investigation , but recalled to jail for breaching the terms of his licence .
police are still looking for two other people who they believe fled the scene .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: lake is 'second most popular ' attraction in east anglia
text: a suffolk lake and nature reserve has been named as the second most visited free attraction in the east of england .
according to visitengland 's annual attractions survey , needham lake and nature reserve saw an estimated 384,000 visitors last year , an increase of 16.7 % .
david hughes , the countryside and public realm officer for babergh and mid suffolk council , put the attraction 's popularity down to its location .

he said : `` it 's close to needham market , stowmarket and ipswich so it 's a very handy place to call in , it has good footpaths , great scenery and we try to manage it so it attracts lots of different things for people to do . ''
the fitzwilliam museum in cambridge topped visitengland 's list for the eastern region , while wyken hall gardens and vineyards , near bury st edmunds , was ranked sixth .
nationally , the british museum was the most visited free attraction in england last year , according to the figures .
author: Luke Deal
BBC Radio Suffolk

right place , right time .

a licence is a privilege not a right !

text: it 's been a bit of a mixed bag weather-wise in the county today , starting off quite bright and sunny but turning very wet and windy through the afternoon .
however , it does n't stop our bbc weather watchers from getting out and about , snapping the sights .
here are some of the best from today
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: bin lorry fire in soham
text: firefighters were called to tackle a bin lorry on fire in soham earlier today .
east cambridgeshire district council say that there were no injuries , but have advised residents that services may be running late .
the fire-damaged vehicle in northfield is due to be collected later .
an investigation is under way .
footage shows bin lorry on fire in soham .
@ twitterid say no one was injured and investigation is under way .
the one in stanground peterborough drives so fast in reverse im exprecting it to burn out the brakes and engine very soon .
reckless
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: smithy fen landlord 'wants to work with council '
text: the owner of eight illegally parked caravans on a travellers site in cottenham says he wants the council to stop making him `` put people out in the road '' .
south cambridgeshire district council issued a notice against tenants at smithy fen travellers site , ordering them to remove the caravans that should n't be there within 28 days .
that time period was up yesterday and the council confirmed they were starting legal action .
but patrick carthy , who is a landlord on the site , says he wants to work with the council .
`` people come to me asking me for help , '' he said .
`` i 'm happy to work with the council and say i can provide temporary housing for them until [ the council ] find somewhere suitable for them to go .
`` if that 's my good deed and getting it 's me in to trouble , does it make me a bad person ?
i do n't think so .
`` i 'm not saying i should n't be told off , but clearly there 's an issue with housing in cambridge . ''
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: killed driver 'will be missed ' says rugby club
text: the rugby club which a man who was killed on the b1040 yesterday belonged to has paid tribute to him .
peterborough rugby club said that mark collin , 51 , of stonald avenue , whittlesey , will be `` sadly missed '' .
mr collin , who had played the juggers veterans team for the past two years , was killed in a crash on the road beween pondersbridge and whittlesey yesterday morning .
`` if there was no game he would play for any team that were short , '' the statement said .
`` he has played for the 2 's , 3 's and juggers and if he could n't get a game there he 'd play for anyone else who were short like deeping or thorney . ''
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: third man dies after crewe crane collapse
text: a third man who was hurt when a crane collapsed in crewe has died , more than a month after the incident happened , police say .

two building workers , david newall , who was 36 , from bradford , and 18-year-old rhys barker , from castleford , west yorkshire , had already been named as having been killed when the collapse happened on 21 june on dunwoody way .
today , cheshire police said david webb ( who was 43 , and originally from northampton but living in st neots , cambridgeshire , had died from the injuries he suffered .
his family have described him as a `` fun loving character who lived his life to the full '' .
cheshire police say their investigation , alongside the health and safety executive , the local authority and building control , is still ongoing .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man avoids jail for his part in football fan attack
text: a man has avoided a prison sentence for his part in an incident which left a football fan brain damaged .
cambridge united supporter simon dobbin ( has been unable to walk or talk since the attack , which happened after he watched his team play in southend in 2015 .
ian young , 41 , of brightwell avenue in westcliff-on-sea , was today given an 18-month suspended prison sentence for assisting an offender .
last month , twelve others were jailed for the attack .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: cambridge sign brown on two-year deal
text: cambridge sign brown on two-year deal

documents.title: march stolen horses : eighth horse found
text: the eighth and final horse stolen from a field near march has been recovered safe and well , its owner has confirmed .
barbie , a palomino mare , was taken along with seven other horses and foals on 13 july when thieves cut through a 12,000-volt electric fence .
two were found in christchurch and five in a field near beck row travellers ' site in suffolk , police said .
but barbie was nowhere to be found .
jo everett , who owns the horses and foals alongside her husband daniel , said that she `` received an anonymous text '' with the location of where the last horse could be found last saturday .
writing on facebook , mrs everett said she `` called the police but due to it being saturday night and a high level of dependency they could not attend '' .
`` dan was told he would recieve no help in recovering our property , '' she said .
`` so on sunday morning , dan and myself drove back to the address near mildenhall , suffolk .
`` i climbed a huge mud bank and looked out across a huge turf field .
standing behind a tethered cob was a miniature in the distance .
`` as i got closer i saw it was barbie .
`` she was not tied but did have a cut to her face .
i head-collared her and walked her two miles away from the field . ''
although the couple was delighted to have all of their horses back , mrs everett was disappointed that they had to retrieve barbie without the police 's help .
in response , cambridgeshire police said `` demand for our services has never been higher and we have to prioritise every call for service alongside the crimes and incidents ongoing at that time .
`` this means we have to be realistic about what we can and can not attend , and make some difficult decisions around resource management . ''
talking about her horses , mrs everett said : my girls are not the most important thing in the world but they are the most important thing in my world . ''
some of the horses had minor injuries when they were found and she said they were still being cared for by a vet , but she was hopeful they would all recover fully .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: posh and u 's in transfer action
text: both peterborough united and cambridge united have been in transfer action overnight , strengthening their squads ahead of the season that begins this saturday .
posh announced the signing of 17-year-old striker idris kanu from national league side aldershot town on a three-year deal .
the teenager had only signed his first professional deal with the non-league side just six months ago - which was to run until the summer of 2019 .
he had spent time at west ham 's academy and had a trial with manchester united 's under-18 side .
posh manager grant mccann called kanu `` quick , strong and good with both feet . ''
meanwhile cambridge united announced that they have signed jevani brown from st neots .
brown , 22 , recently impressed while on trial with the u 's , having started his career with peterborough .
he joins as a free agent on a two year deal .

documents.title: car involved in fatal collision was stolen
text: a black audi s3 involved in a fatal collision on the b1040 between whittlesey and pondersbridge yesterday was stolen , say police .
it was involved in a crash with a nissan primera , whose driver died as a result .
the audi had been stolen from the northamptonshire area .
police say they believe that two other people made off from the stolen car and police are trying to trace them .
the driver of the audi has been arrested on sus of dangerous driving and remains in custody .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: whittlesey man killed in b1040 crash
text: a man from whittlesey died in a crash on the b1040 in the early hours of yesterday morning .
mark collin , 51 , of stonald avenue , was killed when the green nissan primera he was in collided with a black audi s3 between whittlesey and pondersbridge at about 04:20 .
the driver of the audi was arrested on sus of dangerous driving and remains in custody .
the road was closed for several hours and reopened at about 18:30 .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingman identified in fatal crash
text: a man who died in a crash on the b1040 near to whittlesey yesterday has been named as mark collin , 51 , of stonald avenue , whittlesey .

have a great evening .

documents.title: incinerator find follows search at landfill site
text: airman corrie mckeague , based at raf honington , disappeared in the early hours of 24 september last year after a night out in bury st edmunds .
police had been searching a landfill site at milton , near cambridge , following a theory that mr mckeague may have been taken by a rubbish truck after sleeping in a bin .
but they called off the search on 21 july having found no trace of him .
today they have announced that material found at an incinerator in great blakenham , near ipswich , needs further examination to see whether it is linked to him .

documents.title: corrie-hunt police promised to search 'preserved waste '
text: suffolk police have today announced that material found at an incinerator at great blakenham , near ipswich ( needs further examination to see if it is linked to missing airman corrie mckeague .
it was on the afternoon of 21 july that officers announced their decision to end their search for missing raf honington serviceman mr mckeague at a landfill site at milton , near cambridge .
at the same time , officers said their search `` remains a live and active investigation '' and that their work to locate mr mckeague remained ongoing .
`` this will include work to search preserved waste that was incinerated to see if this will establish if there are any further clues as to what happened to corrie , '' a spokesman said .
`` this incinerated waste will be subject to examination and where necessary forensic analysis in the coming weeks . ''

documents.title: the latest forecast : a mostly clear night with rain tomorrow
text: isolated showers will die away to leave a mostly dry night with clear spells , and high cloud .
staying mild , with temperatures falling to 11c ( 52f ) .
there 'll be some bright spells tomorrow , but thickening cloud will bring patchy outbreaks of rain which will turn heavier and more persistent .
south-westerly winds will freshen and become blustery by evening .
temperatures peaking at 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: weather-hit roads get improvement cash
text: two road schemes affected by the weather are to benefit from government funding .
they will share £ 4m of cash from the department for transport as part of a national scheme of road maintenance announced earlier in january .
marine parade ( in southend , which has been affected by flooding , and fen roads in cambridgeshire hit by drought are to get £ 0.56m and £ 3.5m respectively .

transport minister jesse norman said cash for the southend project would be spent on renewing and upgrading `` gullies and drainage networks in three hotspot areas with the most surface water flooding identified . ''

more than 65km ( 40 miles ) of drought-damaged fen roads across cambridgeshire and peterborough will be repaired and `` innovative methods to maintain fen roads and enhance the resilience of the rural road network against future weather events '' will be put in place .
mr norman added most of the schemes will be delivered within the next twelve months , so many drivers will see an immediate impact . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: corrie mckeague : statement from police on incinerator waste
text: suffolk police have issued statement in relation to the on-going search for raf honington serviceman corrie mckeague .

a spokesman said : police searching incinerated waste at the great blakenham energy-from-waste facility have recovered some material that requires further examination in order to establish whether it is in any way connected to the corrie mckeague missing person inquiry .
`` at this stage it can not be confirmed whether or not this material is in any way linked to corrie and so it will be subject to specialist examination and forensic analysis in the coming weeks .
`` police expected that it would be necessary to take items recovered from the search away from the site in order to examine them more carefully .
`` corrie 's family have been kept updated about the search .
the search of the incinerated waste is now complete . ''

documents.title: smithy fen resident : 'i 'm scared of being homeless '
text: earlier we brought you news that south cambridgeshire district council was looking to prosecute landlords and tenants on smithy fen who had failed to corporate with 28-day notice to remove any illegal caravans and static homes .
the offending caravans had been advertised on websites as holiday homes .
a resident of the site in cottenham says she was only in her caravan for two weeks before being asked to leave .
michelle scarlett , 54 , is disabled and moved in to the site after being homeless for over a year after coming out of hospital .
`` when i got better , i looked on the internet and found there was a caravan to rent , '' she said .
`` we 're not travellers but if they 're offering a home to a homeless person , you 're going to take it .
`` we moved in and now we 've got to leave .
i 'm scared of being homeless again .
`` nobody knows what 's going on . ''
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: 'enforcement policy is clear ' says deputy leader
text: the deputy leader of south cambridgeshire district council , nick wright , has said they have decided to prosecute landlords and tenants at smithy fen travellers site in cottenham `` who have not paid any attention to the notices '' .
twenty eight days ago , the council ordered caravans and static homes that were found on the site illegally to be removed .
that period of time is up today .
`` the council enforcement policy is very clear on this matter , '' said mr wright .
`` where breaches have been notified and people have not taken steps to remedy the situation or to actually seek our help to get it right , then this council will take enforcement action .
`` we 're anxious to get the land back to a travellers site for travellers . ''
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: peterborough milkman loses teeth in assault
text: a milkman in peterborough was left missing two front teeth after an assault earlier this morning .
the man in his 50s was delivering milk in belsay drive , stanground at about 03:45 when he noticed a group of three men close to his float , cambridgeshire police said .
one of the men attempted to steal a crate of milk and , when challenged , assaulted the milkman .
following the assault , the three men stole his milk float and left the area .
the vehicle was later recovered in eye .
the victim 's wallet and a crate of milk were stolen , as well as a number of bottles being damaged .
the man who carried out the assault is described as white , aged 16-20 , 5'10 '' and with short brown hair .
the other two men are described as white and aged 16-20 .
det sgt tom rowe called it a `` particularly nasty unprovoked attack on a milkman innocently working his round '' .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: prosecutions to be brought against smithy fen landlords
text: landlords at a travellers ' site near cambridge , who have failed to remove unauthorised caravans and static homes , will be prosecuted , south cambridgeshire district council has confirmed today .

last month the bbc revealed that some travellers on the smithy fen site at cottenham had flouted planning permission by exceeding the permitted number of caravans on site - and renting them out to non-travellers .
landlords were given 28 days for the illegal caravans and static homes to be removed .
that 28 day notice expires today .

the council says it has monitored activity at the site during the last four weeks and say that a number of people , and some caravans , that were on the site illegally have already moved on - but a full assessment is needed over the coming days to identify the current breaches of planning in relation to the notices issued .
they also say they are supporting 12 families with medical conditions or young children who have made contact since the breach of planning notices were issued .
no legal action will be taken against families who have contacted the council and will be moved on over the next six weeks .
there are 49 legal pitches at smithy fen .
each one is made up of a static caravan and a touring caravan .
of the 49 pitches , 22 were in breach of planning due to excess caravans or static homes , or being rented to a non-traveller .
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: 'head on ' collision kills man
text: the fire service say it was a `` head on '' two-vehicle collision that killed one man on the b1040 earlier this morning .
it happened at about 04:20 between whittlesey and pondersbridge .
fire officers freed the driver of one car using specialist cutting equipment , but unfortunately he died at the scene .
the driver of the other vehicle has been arrested on sus of dangerous driving .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shotguns and cufflinks among items stolen in burglary
text: a number of items including a car have been stolen from a burglary at a house in holme , south of peterborough .

the offenders broke in to a property on church street and stole £ 1,800 in cash , three shotguns , an armani watch and a pair of silver cufflinks , before stealing a dark grey toyota hi lux from the driveway .
it happened between on friday between 07:15 and 11:45 .
anyone who witnessed anything out of the ordinary is asked to contact police .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man dies after collision
text: a man has died on the b1040 after a two-vehicle collision earlier this morning .
it happened at about 04:20 between whittlesesy and pondersbridge and the road is currently closed in both directions .
one of the drivers suffered fatal injuries and sadly died at the scene .
the male driver of the other vehicle has been arrested on sus of dangerous driving and has been taken to thorpe wood police station in peterborough .
the road is likely to be closed for some time today and a diversion is in place ( above ) .

text: we 're hearing from police that the b1040 in pondersbridge , between whittlesey and ramsey , could be closed in both directions all day due to a crash between two cars .
it happened at about 04:30 and the road has been closed since then .
traffic is being diverted via the b1095 to the a605 in whittlesey .

text: a few isolated showers across the bbc east region this evening , but these will die away to leave much of the night dry with clear spells , and perhaps a few mist patches forming .
southwesterly winds will ease overnight , with temperatures falling to 10c ( 50f ) in the countryside .
after a dry and bright start to tuesday , increasing cloud will bring a few scattered showers from the southwest , some heavy with perhaps hail and thunder , but interspersed with sunshine .
light southwesterly winds , with top temperatures of about 23c ( 73f ) .
get more on the forecast where you live , from bbc weather .

documents.title: interview : macanthony opens up in pre-season chat
text: the chairman of peterborough united has spoken openly about his hopes ahead of next season as he looks to push his team to promotion .
darragh macanthony says he feel this summer 's transfer business `` has been the most productive '' since he 's been at the club .
in an extended interview , he talks about summer signings , last season 's ups and downs and how he thinks manager grant mccann has done so far .
macanthony said he `` just wants to run a successful club where the fans are happy '' .
`` the team is a lot better [ than last season ] and i think there 's a lot more to come from them , '' he said .
`` the business we 've done is fronting us in the right direction and we think we 'll be a better football club for it today , tomorrow , six months ' time and a year 's time . ''
hear the full interview below
cambridge united fans can hear an extended interview with chairman dave doggett here .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

services are still delayed , with some cancelled .
full updates can be found on the greater anglia website .

documents.title: officer left needing stitches after attack
text: a police officer was left needing stitches after an attack in cambridge on saturday .
the incident took place in sturton street at about 21:15 when police assisted the ambulance service attending a 25-year-old man who needed medical treatment .
the man , from st neots , allegedly headbutted an officer leaving him requiring treatment , say police .
he was arrested on sus of assault , but later released under investigation .
officers originally attended following request to assist @ twitterid medical evidence to be obtained prior to cps decision .
a 25 yr old male from eaton socon has been released under investigation after an officer was headbutted requiring him to have stitches .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: posh and cambridge pre-season review
text: with less than a week left until the beginning of the new football league season , i 've been mulling over the facts and figures from both the posh and u 's pre-season friendlies .
peterborough united
owner darragh macanthony has promised peterborough will deliver `` entertainment and goals '' come the start of the new season .
if their warm-up campaign is considered any kind of indication , then he may well be right .
posh have scored 29 goals across their 10 matches , with summer signing ricky miller notching eight .

having studied the likes of sheffield united and bristol city from recent seasons , grant mccann looks set to start the season by playing with three central defenders , which should lend extra numbers in attack , but could leave posh exposed on the flanks .
leo da silva lopes and gwion edwards have applied themselves well as wing-backs , and much will depend on how quickly they 're able to adapt .
cambridge united
shaun derry 's cambridge united side have generally been at their best over recent seasons when they 've adopted a high-tempo , high-energy , pressing game .
this has largely been the case during pre-season as well .
of their new signings , gary deegan has looked particularly impressive in central midfield , but they 've struggled to score goals , which is perhaps a little concerning .
the u 's failed to win any of their opening eight league matches at the start of last season .
they 'll be hoping they 're rather better prepared come saturday 's opening day trip to exeter .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

text: i do n't want to tempt fate , but it 's been a very nice day outside today , with sun across the majority of the county .

documents.title: traffic officer numbers fall
text: the number of road traffic officers in cambridgeshire has declined by 34 % over the past 10 years , a freedom of information request has found .
there are now 65 officers compared to 88 in 2012 and 98 in 2007 .
however , the drop was in line with the national which found traffic officer numbers across the country have fallen by a third in the last decade .
the figures were supplied by 30 of the 45 uk police forces .
cambridgeshire is of course now linked with bedfordshire and hertfordshire as part of a joint road policing unit .
bedfordshire saw a 42 % reduction .
however , hertfordshire saw a 44 % increase in traffic officers .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man named in peterborough fatal crash
text: a man has been named following a fatal collision in peterborough on friday afternoon .
kevin goodchild , 60 , of cherrytree grove in the city , was riding a grey piaggio motorcycle in gunthorpe road at about 15:40 when he was involved in a collision .
for unknown reasons the motorcycle left the carriageway and collided with a bus shelter , police say .
police , ambulance and the air ambulance all attended , however , sadly kevin 's injuries proved fatal .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: chatteris service marks 100 years since start of passchendaele
text: i 've been in chatteris marking 100 years since the start of the world war one battle of passchendaele - a battle synonymous with loss - including 65 men from the cambridgeshire regiment .
around 500,000 men from the allied and german sides were killed and wounded during more than three months of fighting .
commemorations have been taking place in belgium over the weekend , with more planned today across the uk , including this one in the cambridgeshire town in which four men who died were linked to .
service in chatteris to mark passchendaele , 100 yrs today .
@ bbccambs 95.7/96fm 1026mw dab freeview 722 .
author: John Devine
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: increased police presence after peterborough stabbing
text: police have confirmed that there `` will be a high-visibility presence '' in hampton area of peterborough in the coming days after two men were stabbed on saturday .
they say the increased number of officers will be to `` reassure people '' .
two men were admitted to hospital with serious , but not life-threatening , injuries .
three men who were originally arrested were released with no further action .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

one lane is blocked and delays are expected for some time .
police say no injuries have been reported .

documents.title: steven taylor : 'peterborough is the team for me '
text: peterborough united 's new signing has said he does n't just want his spell at peterborough united to be a short one .
the 31-year-old joined posh last week on a two-year deal .
taylor , who made 268 appearances for newcastle united , says he `` wants to be part of something special '' whilst at london road .
`` i just want to enjoy my football '' defender steven taylor on joining peterborough
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: in sunny sunday at cambridge folk festival
text: after rain on saturday night , the final day of the cambridge folk festival began with beautiful sunshine .
sunday 's headliners were the wonderful loudon wainwright iii and jake bugg , who delighted fans on the main stage .

neil king , editor of acoustic magazine fatea , said the reorganisation of the layout of the festival had worked : `` it 's nice to see the opening up of space at the festival - it 's been really successful .
`` it 's a pity the rain meant could n't take full advantage of it . ''
norwich-born folk singer hannah sanders , who played in the club tent on friday with ben savage , said : `` it 's been a great festival - so big and everyone wants to be here . ''
cambridge singer-songwriter kerry devine said : `` my parents came to the festival before i was born , so to come here and play has been a dream come true . ''

scottish duo twelfth day played in the den on sunday featuring catriona price ( fiddle , vocals ) , who also performed at cherry hinton hall as a member of orkney group fara , and esther swift ( pedal harp and vocals ) .
they won over the audience with self-penned songs with a political edge as well as fascinating instrumentals .
another singer-songwriter who played the den a few years back is london 's jake isaac , who owned stage two on sunday night this year .
he told me he loved the diversity of music at cambridge .
so that was my excellent weekend at cambridge .
you can listen again to bbc local radio 's sue marchant , who presented her sunday evening show live from the festival .
time for me to start thinking about the folk east festival which takes place at glemham hall on the suffolk coast , 18-20 august .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: brain-damaged utd fan 's wife to campaign for tougher sentences
text: the wife of a man left with brain damage after a brutal assault following a football match has called for harsher sentences for violent attackers .
cambridge united fan simon dobbin , 44 , has been unable to walk or talk since the attack in southend two years ago .
twelve men have been jailed , with all handed sentences of five years or less .
`` i understand the maximum sentence for violent disorder is five years , but they will serve two-and-a-half years , '' said nicole dobbin .
`` we 've already done that - we 've got a life sentence . ''
mrs dobbin , who lives with her husband in mildenhall in suffolk , said she planned to campaign to ensure anyone convicted of violent disorder would go to prison for at least 10 years .
she said she also wanted each individual in groups of attackers to be charged with the same offence in cases where someone has been seriously hurt .
mr dobbin spent a year in hospital following the attack which happened after his team , cambridge united , faced southend united at roots hall .
mrs dobbin revealed her plans on saturday at the first match between cambridge and southend united since march 2015 , when her husband was attacked .
`` if it prevents one person from joining in an attack , we will have achieved something , '' said ms dobbin , who gave up her full-time job to become her husband 's carer .
the twelve men involved attacking mr dobbin were handed jail terms of between 16 months and five years earlier this month .
a 13th man will be sentenced in august .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: men hurt in 'serious assault '
text: two men have been seriously injured after being stabbed in peterborough at the weekend .
what police are calling a `` serious assault '' took place at about 19:30 on saturday in westlake avenue , hampton , near to the moorhen pub .
the men 's injuries are not thought to be life-threatening , say police .
one was taken by air ambulance to addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge and the other went to peterborough city hospital ( pch ) .
police say that the attendance of armed officers at pch on the same night was connected to the hampton incident , but could n't give any more details .
three men were arrested in connection with the assault , but were later released with no further action .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire
